questions.question: What are QPR's main team colors?
questions.explanation: QPR's colors are blue and white, which you can see on our kit!

questions.question: What does QPR stand for?
questions.explanation: Queens Park Rangers - that's our club!

questions.question: How many players are in our U11B starting lineup?
questions.explanation: U11 plays with 7 players on the field (including goalkeeper)!

questions.question: What formation do we usually play?
questions.explanation: Our coach loves the 3-3-1 formation for U11!

questions.question: How long is a professional football match?
questions.explanation: A professional match is 90 minutes plus stoppage time!

questions.question: What is it called when a player scores three goals in one match?
questions.explanation: A hat-trick! It's a great achievement!

questions.question: Which body part can't touch the ball in football (except goalkeeper)?
questions.explanation: Players can't use hands or arms, but shoulders are allowed!

questions.question: How many players are on a full football team?
What is the penalty area also called?
questions.explanation: It has many names - they're all correct!

questions.question: Who is the only player allowed to use hands?
questions.explanation: Only the goalkeeper can use hands, and only in their penalty area!

questions.question: Which footballer is famous for the 'Siu' celebration?
What does a yellow card mean?
questions.explanation: Yellow card is a warning from the referee!

questions.question: How many teams play in the Premier League?
questions.explanation: 20 teams compete in the Premier League each season!

questions.question: What happens if you get two yellow cards?
questions.explanation: Two yellows equal a red card - you're sent off!
